value.title: Dynamic labels in Power BI using DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick uses a little DAX, and the SelectedValue function, to get you some dynamic labels in your Power BI reports.  For more information about SelectedValue, check out Marco Russo's blog on the function - https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/using-the-selectedvalue-function-in-dax/  LET'S CONNECT!

value.title: Explicit Vs Implicit DAX Measures in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you ever tried to connect to a Power BI dataset from Excel using Analyze in Excel? if yes, you might have had this experience that your values don‚Äôt show in Excel‚Äôs Pivot table as values. This is because those values are not explicit measures, they are implicit measures in Power BI. In this article
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/f7g6EvNGClQ" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to use AddColumns function in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: AddColumns is a DAX function that is helpful often when writing calculations in Power BI. In this article and video, I‚Äôll explain how you can use it to add calculated columns on the fly to the virtual tables in measures or directly in a table. download the Power BI file from my blog article here: https://radacad.com/how-to-use-addcolumns-function-in-dax-and-power-bi

value.title: Power BI DAX Back to Basics   Scalar Vs Tabular Functions
value.excerpt: DAX is the analytical language in Power BI. Learning this language, however, comes with some difficulties. Part of that challenge is the way that functions work in DAX. Learning the output of functions is an important element of learning how and where you can use them. In this video, I'll explain two

value.title: Power BI Modeling Tip   Snapshot Table or DAX Measures
value.excerpt: I often get this question: ‚ÄúIs it better that I create this calculation as a snapshot table in Power Query (or T-SQL, or the data source), or write DAX measures for it?‚Äù If you ever had a scenario of creating a report of snapshots, you know what I mean. ‚ÄúShould I have a table for inventory stock on hand

value.title: Previous Dynamic Period using DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Parallel Period is a function that helps you fetching the previous period of a Month, Quarter, or Year. However, if you have a dynamic range of date, and you want to find the previous period of that dynamic selection, then Parallel Period can‚Äôt give you the answer. As an example; if the user selected

value.title: Analyzing a slow report query in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Investigate a slow query in a Power BI report using DAX Studio, looking at the query plan and the server timings. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/ Optimizing DAX Workshop: https://www.sqlbi.com/p/optimizing-dax-video-course/

value.title: Apply AND Logic to Multiple Selection in DAX Slicer
value.excerpt: When you apply a multiple selection to a slicer or to a filter, you obtain a logical OR condition between selected items. This video shows how to implement a logical AND condition in a measure instead of the standard OR one. Article and download: https://sql.bi/26121?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tONOosN1xAs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Comparing with previous selected time period in DAX

value.title: Computing a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can use DAX Studio to evaluate one or more measures in your data model. This is the first step to write, test, and debug your DAX measures in a productive manner.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
